medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent fevers and new-onset back and leg pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 11 weeks prior to admission with subjective fevers and chills following vaccinations. Low back pain started two weeks before presentation, radiating to the left thigh, gradually increasing to severe pain (10/10) without improvement following acetaminophen. Pain also radiated to both knees with a fever rise to 39.4 to 40.6°C associated with chills, sweats, abdominal pain, and decreased appetite shortly before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes mellitus for more than 10 years, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, headaches, chronic peripheral edema, vitamin D deficiency, osteoarthritis, exposure to hepatitis B virus, Helicobacter pylori infection treated four months earlier, and history of malaria.
medical_history.social_history: Born in East Africa, lived in a refugee camp for 5 years, moved to the Middle East for 4 years where she consumed unpasteurized camel’s milk, returned to New England 5 months prior, lived with relatives, did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
